p: The questionnaire included six questions about demographic characteristics and past medical history to assess gender, age, province of residence, years of formal education, employment status (full-time, part-time, unemployed, housewife, student, or retired), and chronic diseases (including respiratory problems such as asthma and lung disease, cancer, stroke, diabetes, heart diseases such as heart failure and high blood pressure, kidney diseases such as kidney failure, liver diseases such as hepatitis and cirrhosis, psychiatric illnesses such as depression and anxiety, and alcoholism or drug addiction).
